channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [AMQ-7258] ActiveMQ does not start if Karaf is offline (SAXParseException)
item.description:
To reproduce:

  • Download, unpack and start karaf 4.2.7

feature:repo-add activemq
feature:install activemq-broker

ActiveMQ will start succesfully.
Now stop karaf, go offline and start karaf again.

This time the exception below can be found in the log and ActiveMQ fails to start.

Caused by: org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.XmlBeanDefinitionStoreException: Line 24 in XML document from URL [file:/Users/jkop/Downloads/apache-karaf-4.2.6/etc/activemq.xml] is invalid; nested exception is org.xml.sax.SAXParseException; lineNumber: 24; columnNumber: 101; cvc-elt.1: Cannot find the declaration of element 'beans'.
    at org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.XmlBeanDefinitionReader.doLoadBeanDefinitions(XmlBeanDefinitionReader.java:404) ~[98:org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-beans:5.1.7.RELEASE_1]
    at org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.XmlBeanDefinitionReader.loadBeanDefinitions(XmlBeanDefinitionReader.java:336) ~[98:org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-beans:5.1.7.RELEASE_1]
    at org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.XmlBeanDefinitionReader.loadBeanDefinitions(XmlBeanDefinitionReader.java:304) ~[98:org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-beans:5.1.7.RELEASE_1]
    at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanDefinitionReader.loadBeanDefinitions(AbstractBeanDefinitionReader.java:188) ~[98:org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-beans:5.1.7.RELEASE_1]
    at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanDefinitionReader.loadBeanDefinitions(AbstractBeanDefinitionReader.java:224) ~[98:org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-beans:5.1.7.RELEASE_1]
    at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanDefinitionReader.loadBeanDefinitions(AbstractBeanDefinitionReader.java:195) ~[98:org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-beans:5.1.7.RELEASE_1]
    at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanDefinitionReader.loadBeanDefinitions(AbstractBeanDefinitionReader.java:257) ~[98:org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-beans:5.1.7.RELEASE_1]
    at org.springframework.context.support.AbstractXmlApplicationContext.loadBeanDefinitions(AbstractXmlApplicationContext.java:128) ~[99:org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-context:5.1.7.RELEASE_1]
    at org.springframework.context.support.AbstractXmlApplicationContext.loadBeanDefinitions(AbstractXmlApplicationContext.java:94) ~[99:org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-context:5.1.7.RELEASE_1]
    at org.springframework.context.support.AbstractRefreshableApplicationContext.refreshBeanFactory(AbstractRefreshableApplicationContext.java:133) ~[99:org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-context:5.1.7.RELEASE_1]
    at org.springframework.context.support.AbstractApplicationContext.obtainFreshBeanFactory(AbstractApplicationContext.java:636) ~[99:org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-context:5.1.7.RELEASE_1]
    at org.springframework.context.support.AbstractApplicationContext.refresh(AbstractApplicationContext.java:521) ~[99:org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-context:5.1.7.RELEASE_1]
    at org.apache.activemq.osgi.ActiveMQServiceFactory.updated(ActiveMQServiceFactory.java:126) ~[59:org.apache.activemq.activemq-osgi:5.15.9]
    ... 7 more


org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: schema_reference.4: Failed to read schema document 'http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans/spring-beans.xsd', because 1) could not find the document; 2) the document could not be read; 3) the root element of the document is not <xsd:schema>.
    at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.util.ErrorHandlerWrapper.createSAXParseException(ErrorHandlerWrapper.java:203) ~[?:?]
    at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.util.ErrorHandlerWrapper.warning(ErrorHandlerWrapper.java:99) [?:?]

    at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.xs.traversers.XSDHandler.getSchemaDocument(XSDHandler.java:2193) [?:?]
    at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.xs.traversers.XSDHandler.parseSchema(XSDHandler.java:578) [?:?]

    at org.apache.activemq.osgi.ActiveMQServiceFactory.updated(ActiveMQServiceFactory.java:126) [59:org.apache.activemq.activemq-osgi:5.15.9]

item.summary: ActiveMQ does not start if Karaf is offline (SAXParseException)

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

jbonofre - it seems that the Kafaf itests broke after this update: 

 

https://builds.apache.org/view/A/view/ActiveMQ/job/ActiveMQ-Java8/1305/org.apache.activemq$activemq-karaf-itest/testReport/junit/org.apache.maven.surefire.junit4/JUnit4Provider/org_apache_activemq_karaf_itest_ActiveMQBrokerNdCamelFeatureTest/

https://builds.apache.org/view/A/view/ActiveMQ/job/ActiveMQ-Java8/1305/org.apache.activemq$activemq-karaf-itest/testReport/org.apache.activemq.karaf.itest/ActiveMQBrokerNdCamelFeatureTest/org_apache_activemq_karaf_itest_ActiveMQBrokerNdCamelFeatureTest/
cshannon yeah, I saw that, it's weird as it's passed on the PR. Let me take a look thanks (I'm working on other PRs right now).

Commit f509067d2564238221eae01ab2fbc7bb1d1230f8 in activemq's branch refs/heads/master from Jean-Baptiste Onofré
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=activemq.git;h=f509067 ]

Revert "AMQ-7258 Update spring.schemas in activemq-osgi"

This reverts commit 3c71b5e8aa4389ad70567272de34e3b8a62ff6d0.

Commit 4a903356b9b08e5688d20b931d64434c89039011 in activemq's branch refs/heads/activemq-5.15.x from Jean-Baptiste Onofré
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=activemq.git;h=4a90335 ]

Revert "AMQ-7258 Update spring.schemas in activemq-osgi"

This reverts commit 52e72949f2cacfe6f089b677fa125db37040d74f.
The problem is not actually in ActiveMQ and schema but the fact you are using Spring 5 (ActiveMQ only supports Spring 4 for now).

Hmm.. but still activemq-osgi import-packages states that version 5 of spring-framework is fine?

org.springframework.jms*;version="[4,5)";resolution:=optional,
org.springframework.transaction*;version="[4,5)";resolution:=optional,
org.springframework*;version="[4,5)";resolution:=optional,

Appologies if my comments are not useful, but these issues (mentioned in the Jira description) seems to be present on Karaf 4.2.1, 4.2.2, 4.2.3, 4.2.4, 4.2.5, 4.2.6 and 4.2.7 for Apacge 5.15.10

Karaf 4.1.7 seems to work fine with ApacheMQ 5.15.10

 
karaf@root()> feature:list | grep active
activemq-broker-noweb         | 5.15.10          |          | Uninstalled | activemq-5.15.10                  | Full ActiveMQ broker with default configuration
activemq-broker               | 5.15.10          | x        | Started     | activemq-5.15.10                  | Full ActiveMQ broker with default configuration a
activemq-camel                | 5.15.10          |          | Uninstalled | activemq-5.15.10                  |
activemq-web-console          | 5.15.10          |          | Started     | activemq-5.15.10                  |
activemq-blueprint            | 5.15.10          |          | Uninstalled | activemq-5.15.10                  |
activemq-amqp-client          | 5.15.10          |          | Uninstalled | activemq-5.15.10                  | ActiveMQ AMQP protocol client libraries
activemq-client               | 5.15.10          |          | Started     | activemq-core-5.15.10             | ActiveMQ client libraries
activemq-cf                   | 5.15.10          |          | Uninstalled | activemq-core-5.15.10             | ActiveMQ ConnectionFactory from config
activemq                      | 5.15.10          |          | Started     | activemq-core-5.15.10             | ActiveMQ broker libraries

However, Karaf 4.2.6 is obviously far better than 4.1.7, its unfair of me to ask jbonofre but is there any workaround possible to get Karaf 4.2.6 to work with ActiveMQ 5.15.10 (again I appreciate its not really your problem).

It just works fine. Before installing activemq feature, you just have to add the spring-legacy one.

I tested ActiveMQ 5.15.x on Karaf 4.2.x several times without issue.

Basically, you have to do:

karaf@root()> feature:repo-add spring-legacy
karaf@root()> feature:repo-add activemq 5.15.10
karaf@root()> feature:install activemq-broker

it should work straight forward.

jbonofre sorry to question your tests, but just to be sure you did this offline? Or atleast restarting karaf offline, that should reproduce the error. The issue here seems to be that if running karaf offline it doesn't find the correct spring.xsd schemas, despite adding the spring-legacy repo.

jbonofre since https://github.com/apache/activemq/commit/c628357f91c5f4f71b9106b30a43ea86230c6044#diff-d5b8d20ad29a25abf3fbd33c79dafc9e I got karaf & activemq to work offline by including Spring 5 schemas in activemq-osgi, and changing activemq.xml in activemq-karaf to support these changes. Does this sound logical or?

http\://www.springframework.org/schema/beans/spring-beans.xsd=org/springframework/beans/factory/xml/spring-beans.xsd 
http\://www.springframework.org/schema/beans/spring-tools.xsd=org/springframework/beans/factory/xml/spring-tools.xsd 
http\://www.springframework.org/schema/beans/spring-util.xsd=org/springframework/beans/factory/xml/spring-util.xsd
The change you mentioned is to support Spring 5, it's not related to "offline". I tested offline with Karaf 4.2.7 without problem. Thanks for the update anyway.

I do not know what I am doing wrong when I still get the same error. Steps are like in the description.

karaf@root()> feature:repo-add spring-legacy
Adding feature url mvn:org.apache.karaf.features/spring-legacy/4.2.7/xml/features
karaf@root()> feature:repo-add activemq 5.15.9
Adding feature url mvn:org.apache.activemq/activemq-karaf/5.15.9/xml/features
karaf@root()> feature:install activemq-broker

After installing the broker everything works. The I shutdown karaf, unplug the computer from internet and start karaf and I get the same error. Attached complete karaf.log
What Karaf version ?

I am affected by this issue as well, is someone still looking in to it, or is there some workaround I am not aware of? Currently I am running broker version 5.15.8 instead, but that does not seem like a good long term solution...

Hello jbonofre,

I have the same issue using Karaf 4.2.9: i'm not able to install activemq-broker offline.

I attach the pom.xml that i'm using.

To reproduce: compile the pom.xml and copy the target/system into ${KARAF_HOME}.

Then, inside the Karaf console:

1. Add the needed repo:

feature:repo-add mvn:org.apache.cxf.karaf/apache-cxf/3.3.5/xml/features
feature:repo-add mvn:org.apache.camel.karaf/apache-camel/2.24.3/xml/features
feature:repo-add mvn:org.apache.karaf.features/spring/4.2.9/xml/features
feature:repo-add mvn:org.apache.karaf.features/spring-legacy/4.2.9/xml/features
feature:repo-add mvn:org.apache.activemq/activemq-karaf/5.15.11/xml/features-core
feature:repo-add mvn:org.apache.activemq/activemq-karaf/5.15.11/xml/features

2. Install activemq-broker:

karaf@root()> feature:install activemq-broker

but i got:

 Caused by: shaded.org.eclipse.aether.resolution.ArtifactResolutionException: Error resolving artifact org.apache.servicemix.bundles:org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-expression:jar:5.1.14.RELEASE_1 Caused by: shaded.org.eclipse.aether.resolution.ArtifactResolutionException: Error resolving artifact org.apache.servicemix.bundles:org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-expression:jar:5.1.14.RELEASE_1 at shaded.org.eclipse.aether.internal.impl.DefaultArtifactResolver.resolve(DefaultArtifactResolver.java:413) at shaded.org.eclipse.aether.internal.impl.DefaultArtifactResolver.resolveArtifacts(DefaultArtifactResolver.java:215) at shaded.org.eclipse.aether.internal.impl.DefaultArtifactResolver.resolveArtifact(DefaultArtifactResolver.java:192) at shaded.org.eclipse.aether.internal.impl.DefaultRepositorySystem.resolveArtifact(DefaultRepositorySystem.java:247) at org.ops4j.pax.url.mvn.internal.AetherBasedResolver.resolve(AetherBasedResolver.java:767) ... 11 more
Error executing command: Error: 
Error downloading mvn:org.apache.servicemix.bundles/org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-beans/5.1.14.RELEASE_1 
Error downloading mvn:org.apache.servicemix.bundles/org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-context-support/5.1.14.RELEASE_1 
Error downloading mvn:org.apache.servicemix.bundles/org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-core/5.1.14.RELEASE_1 
Error downloading mvn:org.apache.servicemix.bundles/org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-aop/5.1.14.RELEASE_1 
Error downloading mvn:org.apache.servicemix.bundles/org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-context/5.1.14.RELEASE_1 
Error downloading mvn:org.apache.servicemix.bundles/org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-expression/5.1.14.RELEASE_1

How you can see in the attached pom.xml, i'm using the activemq version 5.15.11 and spring version 4.2.9.

Am i forgetting any dependencies?

 

Thanks

Giuseppe

Hi JB,

i saw a similar issue from my side with karaf 4.2.9 in offline environment.

Install of activemq-broker ejects me from ssh session, logs seems ok like the status after a new login:

karaf@root()> feature:list | grep activemq
activemq-client │ 5.15.11 │ │ Started │ activemq-core-5.15.11 │ ActiveMQ client libraries
activemq-cf │ 5.15.11 │ │ Uninstalled │ activemq-core-5.15.11 │ ActiveMQ ConnectionFactory from config
activemq │ 5.15.11 │ │ Started │ activemq-core-5.15.11 │ ActiveMQ broker libraries
activemq-broker-noweb │ 5.15.11 │ │ Uninstalled │ activemq-5.15.11 │ Full ActiveMQ broker with default configuration
activemq-broker │ 5.15.11 │ x │ Started │ activemq-5.15.11 │ Full ActiveMQ broker with default configuration a
activemq-camel │ 5.15.11 │ │ Uninstalled │ activemq-5.15.11 │
activemq-web-console │ 5.15.11 │ │ Started │ activemq-5.15.11 │
activemq-blueprint │ 5.15.11 │ │ Uninstalled │ activemq-5.15.11 │
activemq-amqp-client │ 5.15.11 │ │ Uninstalled │ activemq-5.15.11 │ ActiveMQ AMQP protocol client libraries

but I don't see any listening service at 61616 port and after 5/6 minutes (probably at the socket timeout) I see this error:

I remember in the past a similar issue with some ServiceMix bundle.

Could be a valid solution disable the schema validation in this case? Is it a possibility?

Thanks in advance

Found the problem:

diff --git a/activemq-osgi/pom.xml b/activemq-osgi/pom.xml
index b2bdc42ec..fdb08e254 100644
— a/activemq-osgi/pom.xml
+++ b/activemq-osgi/pom.xml
@@ -62,9 +62,9 @@
       org.apache.zookeeper*;resolution:=optional,
       org.fusesource.leveldbjni*;resolution:=optional,
       org.fusesource.hawtjni*;resolution:=optional,
-      org.springframework.jms*;version="[4,6)";resolution:=optional,
-      org.springframework.transaction*;version="[4,6)";resolution:=optional,
-      org.springframework*;version="[4,6)";resolution:=optional,
+      org.springframework.jms*;version="[4,6)",
+      org.springframework.transaction*;version="[4,6)",
+      org.springframework*;version="[4,6)",
       org.xmlpull*;resolution:=optional,
       scala*;resolution:=optional,
       javax.annotation*;version="[1,4)",
 
The option resolution optional seems doesn't load correctly spring package.

Can anyone release a minor release with this fix?

Also without my patch it seems that start correctly with this steps:

feature:repo-add mvn:org.apache.cxf.karaf/apache-cxf/3.3.5/xml/features
feature:repo-add mvn:org.apache.camel.karaf/apache-camel/2.24.3/xml/features
feature:repo-add mvn:org.apache.karaf.features/spring-legacy/4.2.9/xml/features
feature:repo-add mvn:org.apache.activemq/activemq-karaf/5.15.13/xml/features-core
feature:repo-add mvn:org.apache.activemq/activemq-karaf/5.15.13/xml/features

feature:install spring/4.3.25.RELEASE_1
feature:install spring-jms/4.3.25.RELEASE_1
feature:install spring-web/4.3.25.RELEASE_1

feature:install activemq-broker
It should be fine with Karaf 4.2.8 (Karaf 4.2.9 contains a buggy Felix FileInstall). I'm testing again in offline mode, just to double check.
Oh, I might have found the issue: the embedded spring schema in activemq-osgi are up to Spring 3.x. I'm testing adding Spring 4.x schemas.

I bet the problem is because you are using Spring 5 (you didn't perform feature:repo-add spring-legacy).

I'm improving the situation (to have spring-legacy implicitely) but the issue is because you are using Spring 5 features.
Just add spring-legacy repo before installing activemq features.

ActiveMq broker and client, with Openwire, KahaDb, does not require Spring 4 specifics (loading the activemq.xml file works also with Spring 5).

Under these circumstances, it is fine to use Karaf 4.2.x out of the box.

To solve the offline issue, one solution is to patch activemq-osgi JAR with this spring.schemas file.

The real solution is just to use Spring 4 for now. catshout confirmed that adding spring-legacy repository just works fine. I will update ActiveMQ to Spring 5 to simplify installation (and avoid Spring 4 anymore).
